AcceptPrimaryEmailUpdate.name: AcceptPrimaryEmailUpdate
AcceptPrimaryEmailUpdate.documentation: Accepts the request that originated from StartPrimaryEmailUpdate to update the primary email address (also known as the root user email address) for the specified account.

DeleteAlternateContact.name: DeleteAlternateContact
DeleteAlternateContact.documentation:
Deletes the specified alternate contact from an Amazon Web Services account.

For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.

Before you can update the alternate contact information for an Amazon Web Services account that is managed by Organizations, you must first enable integration between Amazon Web Services Account Management and Organizations. For more information, see Enabling trusted access for Amazon Web Services Account Management.

DisableRegion.name: DisableRegion
DisableRegion.documentation:
Disables (opts-out) a particular Region for an account.

The act of disabling a Region will remove all IAM access to any resources that reside in that Region.

EnableRegion.name: EnableRegion
EnableRegion.documentation: Enables (opts-in) a particular Region for an account.

GetAccountInformation.name: GetAccountInformation
GetAccountInformation.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified account including its account name, account ID, and account creation date and time. To use this API, an IAM user or role must have the account:GetAccountInformation IAM permission.

GetAlternateContact.name: GetAlternateContact
GetAlternateContact.documentation:
Retrieves the specified alternate contact attached to an Amazon Web Services account.

For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.

Before you can update the alternate contact information for an Amazon Web Services account that is managed by Organizations, you must first enable integration between Amazon Web Services Account Management and Organizations. For more information, see Enabling trusted access for Amazon Web Services Account Management.

GetContactInformation.name: GetContactInformation
GetContactInformation.documentation:
Retrieves the primary contact information of an Amazon Web Services account.

For complete details about how to use the primary contact operations, see Update the primary and alternate contact information.

GetPrimaryEmail.name: GetPrimaryEmail
GetPrimaryEmail.documentation: Retrieves the primary email address for the specified account.

GetRegionOptStatus.name: GetRegionOptStatus
GetRegionOptStatus.documentation: Retrieves the opt-in status of a particular Region.

ListRegions.name: ListRegions
ListRegions.documentation: Lists all the Regions for a given account and their respective opt-in statuses. Optionally, this list can be filtered by the region-opt-status-contains parameter.

PutAccountName.name: PutAccountName
PutAccountName.documentation: Updates the account name of the specified account. To use this API, IAM principals must have the account:PutAccountName IAM permission.

PutAlternateContact.name: PutAlternateContact
PutAlternateContact.documentation:
Modifies the specified alternate contact attached to an Amazon Web Services account.

For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.

Before you can update the alternate contact information for an Amazon Web Services account that is managed by Organizations, you must first enable integration between Amazon Web Services Account Management and Organizations. For more information, see Enabling trusted access for Amazon Web Services Account Management.

PutContactInformation.name: PutContactInformation
PutContactInformation.documentation:
Updates the primary contact information of an Amazon Web Services account.

For complete details about how to use the primary contact operations, see Update the primary and alternate contact information.

StartPrimaryEmailUpdate.name: StartPrimaryEmailUpdate
StartPrimaryEmailUpdate.documentation: Starts the process to update the primary email address for the specified account.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

This operation can only be called from the management account or the delegated administrator account of an organization for a member account.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId.

Otp.documentation: The OTP code sent to the PrimaryEmail specified on the StartPrimaryEmailUpdate API call.

PrimaryEmail.documentation: The new primary email address for use with the specified account. This must match the PrimaryEmail from the StartPrimaryEmailUpdate API call.

Status.documentation: Retrieves the status of the accepted primary email update request.

errorType.documentation: The value populated to the x-amzn-ErrorType response header by API Gateway.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: The operation failed because the calling identity doesn't have the minimum required permissions.

EmailAddress.documentation: The email address associated with this alternate contact.

Name.documentation: The name associated with this alternate contact.

PhoneNumber.documentation: The phone number associated with this alternate contact.

Title.documentation: The title associated with this alternate contact.

AlternateContact.documentation: A structure that contains the details of an alternate contact associated with an Amazon Web Services account

errorType.documentation: The value populated to the x-amzn-ErrorType response header by API Gateway.

ConflictException.documentation: The request could not be processed because of a conflict in the current status of the resource. For example, this happens if you try to enable a Region that is currently being disabled (in a status of DISABLING) or if you try to change an account’s root user email to an email address which is already in use.

AddressLine1.documentation: The first line of the primary contact address.

AddressLine2.documentation: The second line of the primary contact address, if any.

AddressLine3.documentation: The third line of the primary contact address, if any.

City.documentation: The city of the primary contact address.

CompanyName.documentation: The name of the company associated with the primary contact information, if any.

CountryCode.documentation: The ISO-3166 two-letter country code for the primary contact address.

DistrictOrCounty.documentation: The district or county of the primary contact address, if any.

FullName.documentation: The full name of the primary contact address.

PhoneNumber.documentation: The phone number of the primary contact information. The number will be validated and, in some countries, checked for activation.

PostalCode.documentation: The postal code of the primary contact address.

StateOrRegion.documentation: The state or region of the primary contact address. If the mailing address is within the United States (US), the value in this field can be either a two character state code (for example, NJ) or the full state name (for example, New Jersey). This field is required in the following countries: US, CA, GB, DE, JP, IN, and BR.

WebsiteUrl.documentation: The URL of the website associated with the primary contact information, if any.

ContactInformation.documentation: Contains the details of the primary contact information associated with an Amazon Web Services account.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.

If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.

To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

AlternateContactType.documentation: Specifies which of the alternate contacts to delete.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

RegionName.documentation: Specifies the Region-code for a given Region name (for example, af-south-1). When you disable a Region, Amazon Web Services performs actions to deactivate that Region in your account, such as destroying IAM resources in the Region. This process takes a few minutes for most accounts, but this can take several hours. You cannot enable the Region until the disabling process is fully completed.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

RegionName.documentation: Specifies the Region-code for a given Region name (for example, af-south-1). When you enable a Region, Amazon Web Services performs actions to prepare your account in that Region, such as distributing your IAM resources to the Region. This process takes a few minutes for most accounts, but it can take several hours. You cannot use the Region until this process is complete. Furthermore, you cannot disable the Region until the enabling process is fully completed.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.

If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.

To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

AccountCreatedDate.documentation: The date and time the account was created.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

This operation can only be called from the management account or the delegated administrator account of an organization for a member account.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId.

Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.

If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.

To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

AlternateContactType.documentation: Specifies which alternate contact you want to retrieve.

AlternateContact.documentation: A structure that contains the details for the specified alternate contact.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

This operation can only be called from the management account or the delegated administrator account of an organization for a member account.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId.

PrimaryEmail.documentation: Retrieves the primary email address associated with the specified account.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

RegionName.documentation: Specifies the Region-code for a given Region name (for example, af-south-1). This function will return the status of whatever Region you pass into this parameter.
The Region code that was passed in.

RegionOptStatus.documentation: One of the potential statuses a Region can undergo (Enabled, Enabling, Disabled, Disabling, Enabled_By_Default).

errorType.documentation: The value populated to the x-amzn-ErrorType response header by API Gateway.

InternalServerException.documentation: The operation failed because of an error internal to Amazon Web Services. Try your operation again later.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

MaxResults.documentation: The total number of items to return in the command’s output. If the total number of items available is more than the value specified, a NextToken is provided in the command’s output. To resume pagination, provide the NextToken value in the starting-token argument of a subsequent command. Do not use the NextToken response element directly outside of the Amazon Web Services CLI. For usage examples, see Pagination in the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface User Guide.

NextToken.documentation: A token used to specify where to start paginating. This is the NextToken from a previously truncated response. For usage examples, see Pagination in the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface User Guide.

RegionOptStatusContains.documentation: A list of Region statuses (Enabling, Enabled, Disabling, Disabled, Enabled_by_default) to use to filter the list of Regions for a given account. For example, passing in a value of ENABLING will only return a list of Regions with a Region status of ENABLING.

NextToken.documentation: If there is more data to be returned, this will be populated. It should be passed into the next-token request parameter of list-regions.

Regions.documentation: This is a list of Regions for a given account, or if the filtered parameter was used, a list of Regions that match the filter criteria set in the filter parameter.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.

If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.

To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.

If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.

To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

AlternateContactType.documentation: Specifies which alternate contact you want to create or update.

EmailAddress.documentation: Specifies an email address for the alternate contact.

Name.documentation: Specifies a name for the alternate contact.

PhoneNumber.documentation: Specifies a phone number for the alternate contact.

Title.documentation: Specifies a title for the alternate contact.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.

To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

ContactInformation.documentation: Contains the details of the primary contact information associated with an Amazon Web Services account.

RegionName.documentation: The Region code of a given Region (for example, us-east-1).

RegionOptStatus.documentation: One of potential statuses a Region can undergo (Enabled, Enabling, Disabled, Disabling, Enabled_By_Default).

Region.documentation: This is a structure that expresses the Region for a given account, consisting of a name and opt-in status.

errorType.documentation: The value populated to the x-amzn-ErrorType response header by API Gateway.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The operation failed because it specified a resource that can't be found.

AccountId.documentation:
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.

This operation can only be called from the management account or the delegated administrator account of an organization for a member account.

The management account can't specify its own AccountId.

PrimaryEmail.documentation: The new primary email address (also known as the root user email address) to use in the specified account.

Status.documentation: The status of the primary email update request.

errorType.documentation: The value populated to the x-amzn-ErrorType response header by API Gateway.

TooManyRequestsException.documentation: The operation failed because it was called too frequently and exceeded a throttle limit.

fieldList.documentation: The field where the invalid entry was detected.

message.documentation: The message that informs you about what was invalid about the request.

ValidationException.documentation: The operation failed because one of the input parameters was invalid.

name.documentation: The field name where the invalid entry was detected.

ValidationExceptionField.documentation: The input failed to meet the constraints specified by the Amazon Web Services service in a specified field.

documentation: Operations for Amazon Web Services Account Management
